timeline.summary: An Assistant United States Attorney is requesting assistance from a witness (Testifying Witness 3500) to locate handwritten interview notes from August 15, 2006, and August 17, 2006. The request is related to materials being prepared for a Monday deadline.

An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking) is requesting assistance from the United States Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York, regarding handwritten interview notes for Testifying Witness 3500. Two sets of notes, dated August 17, 2006, and August 15, 2006, were located in FAA-AMOC flight records and MM13 folders. The Assistant United States Attorney followed up on an earlier email requesting confirmation of the notes’ existence as materials are prepared for a Monday deadline.

An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking) is requesting assistance in locating handwritten interview notes related to “Testifying Witness 3500.” The notes pertain to interviews conducted on August 17, 2006, and August 15, 2006. The notes were initially located in MM13, specifically within the “Flight Records FAA-AMOC” and ‘’ folders. An Assistant United States Attorney is involved in preparing materials for a Monday deadline.

An Assistant United States Attorney is requesting information regarding documents related to an interview conducted on August 22, 2006. Specifically, they are seeking copies of a 302 form and documents related to the interviewee’s hours worked and notes taken while employed by Jeffrey Epstein, referencing a last paragraph in a PDF attachment where she stated she provided these documents.

Andrew, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, is requesting certification of an AT&T record (file code 229703, dated 8/23/2006). He provides a PDF scan and a cover letter, attached to a CD, for this certification request to gtdc@att.com. He includes contact information for questions or difficulties.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is requesting confirmation before changing the tag of a document (EFTA00030865) marked as potential Brady material. The document originated from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] and includes a subpoena issued on March 2, 2007, relating to a grand jury investigation involving the USANYS.

On May 22, 2007, Gerald B. Lefcourt, attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, contacted the Deputy Chief, Northern Region, Office of the United States Attorney, Southern District of Florida, to inform them that Epstein was under grand jury investigation. Lefcourt stated a decision regarding an indictment would be made within the next month or two, and that Epstein’s legal team would be given an opportunity to meet with the prosecutor before any decision is finalized. The correspondence included requests to meet with the Chief of the Criminal Division, First Assistant United States Attorney, and Attorney Alexander Acosta if the initial meeting does not lead to a resolution.

On November 2, 2007, the First Assistant United States Attorney (USAFLS) contacted a recipient regarding the Epstein case settlement agreement. The case disposition conference was set for January 7, 2008, with a planned simultaneous plea and sentencing for January 4, 2008, contingent on Judge McSorley’s approval. A subsequent email from an Assistant State Attorney (ASA) on October 29, 2007, confirmed the settlement’s approval but noted the judge’s preference for a concurrent plea and sentencing, leading to a January 4th scheduling adjustment.

A communication (email) was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida to multiple recipients regarding a civil suit filed in New York against Jeffrey Epstein. The email included a link to an article discussing the case: http://www.abovethelaw.com/2007/11/maximilia_cordero_maybe_not_a.php#more. The email’s subject line was “Civil suit in NY against Epstein”.

A settlement agreement was reached in the Epstein case involving a plea and sentencing. The original agreement stipulated a simultaneous plea and sentencing in October or November 2007, followed by Epstein surrendering for sentencing no later than January 4, 2008. A case disposition conference was set for January 7, 2008, with the judge requesting a concurrent plea and sentencing, leading to a rescheduling for the first week of January. One party requested documents related to the plea, information, and factual proffers. Another individual, a First Assistant United States Attorney, offered assistance and contact information regarding the federal investigation and non-prosecution agreement. A case assistant in Palm Beach County confirmed the settlement was finalized and the judge’s request for a concurrent plea and sentencing led to a January 4th deadline.

Chris Rodgers, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, is following up on a request for a transcript of a civil deposition related to an SDNY investigation. He has located Volume II of the deposition from December 4, 2009, and accompanying exhibits, and is awaiting Volume I from the Court Reporter. The email chain involves communication between Rodgers, Jack Scarola, and [REDACTED] regarding the status of the transcript. The email also includes a disclaimer regarding privileged and confidential electronic communication.

This document pertains to case EFTA00028125, specifically a Protective Order issued on June 12, 2017, titled “2017.06.12_Southside_Protective_Order v4.docx,” sent from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to an unknown recipient.

Bruce Barket of Barket, Epstein & Kearon, LLP sent a response to a disclosure letter regarding EFTA00027954. The correspondence includes contact information for Barket, the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, and a PDF document titled “disclosure letter to==pdf”.

On November 28, 2018, multiple U.S. Assistant United States Attorneys (including those from the Southern District of New York and the Eastern District of New York) discussed a Miami Herald article regarding Alexander Acosta’s handling of Jeffrey Epstein’s plea deal. The conversation involved a desire to investigate Acosta’s role and potentially explore further investigation through someone like “[REDACTED]”. The email chain expresses disbelief and concern about the situation.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York initiated a call to discuss information gathered regarding the Jeffrey Epstein matter.  Two individuals, [REDACTED] and [REDACTED], were invited to the call, initially scheduled for 3:00 or 3:30 PM on November 30, 2018.  The discussion stemmed from news reports, including an article from the Miami Herald concerning a potential financial fraud case involving Epstein.  One individual suggested Epstein’s cooperation in that case and his subsequent non-prosecution.

Several individuals, including an Assistant Special Agent in Charge, a USANYS representative, and an Assistant United States Attorney, discussed coordinating a call regarding the Jeff Epstein matter. Proposed times for the call were 3:00 PM and 3:30 PM on November 30, 2018. An article detailing a financial fraud case involving Epstein was shared, and discussion centered on determining the next steps in the investigation.

On December 5, 2018, an Assistant Special Agent in Charge from the New York Field Office discussed a sealed Federal indictment related to Jeffrey Epstein with colleagues. A meeting was scheduled for December 6, 2018, to discuss next steps following the discussion.  On November 30, 2018, an Assistant United States Attorney proposed a call to determine a plan of action regarding information gathered on the Epstein matter, suggesting times of 3:00 or 3:30 PM. An article from the Miami Herald detailing a financial fraud case involving Epstein was shared.

A correspondence was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York (EFTA00016298), to an unknown recipient regarding files received from a disc. The files were saved to the following location: \\Usa.doj.gov\cloud\ NYS\StAndrews \Shared WSvEpstein-2018801618 \Investigation \ Case File_12.4.18. The email was sent on December 6, 2018.

Multiple individuals involved in an investigation, including an Assistant United States Attorney, FBI agents, and NYPD detectives, coordinate to meet regarding a "New Investigation." Discussions revolve around scheduling a meeting, the exchange of documents (CDs or drives), and logistical challenges such as differing locations (NJ, Suffolk County), court appearances (Mag Court), and a scheduled proffer. Concerns are expressed about time constraints and potential delays in the investigation.  Specific details regarding the case itself (the nature of the investigation, the "case" files, and related documents like PDFs) are redacted.

On December 10, 2018, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York contacted two individuals (“You guys”) requesting a conference call to discuss “a few items.” A response was received from an FBI agent (“N. (NY) (FBI)”) confirming availability and noting the urgency due to preparation for an upcoming event on December 12, 2018.

On December 10, 2018, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York ("MIMI") contacted individuals associated with the FBI and NYPD, specifically Detective Mil, regarding a potential discussion about "Epstein." The communication involved a request to chat after 2:00 PM, with the understanding that a conference call would be necessary due to other commitments. Attached were SOMU records.

The document is a series of emails exchanged between the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York regarding investigations related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails include attachments such as search results, parking summons, and SOMU records. One email discusses a planned call and a request for the recipient to change their name.

Three emails exchanged between individuals associated with the NYPD/FBI’s Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York regarding “Epstein” reports. One email discusses a potential call after 2 PM and mentions a name change. Another email requests a call to discuss “a few items” in preparation for Wednesday, promising a short conversation. A third email includes attached SOMU records.

The document is a series of email exchanges between law enforcement (NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force) and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.  The investigation involves reviewing 911 calls originating from Epstein’s alarm company, searching DAS databases for relevant information, and tracking Epstein’s phone number.  The communications include requests for sprint reports, DAS searches, and the review of SOMU records. Several individuals and locations are redacted.

A preservation request was sent from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to subpoenas@apple.com on December 12, 2018. The request, attached as “12-12-18_Letter to_Apple.pdf,” is related to case EFTA00037895.

On December 12, 2018, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Assistant United States Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, directed Oath Holdings, Inc. to preserve all content associated with specified accounts for 90 days. This preservation includes emails, Google Docs/Drive content, and backups. The preservation is retrospective and does not extend to newly arising information. Disclosure of the letter’s existence is restricted, except for necessary compliance, and requires prior notification to the U.S. Attorney.

A preservation request was sent from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to lawenforcement-request-delivery@oath.com on December 12, 2018. The request, along with a letter to Oath Holdings, is attached. The case is identified as EFTA00037896.

A preservation request, dated December 12, 2018, was sent by the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York regarding file EFTA00037898. The request included an attached document named “12-12-18.”

The document consists of email exchanges between individuals associated with the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the FBI regarding the Jeffrey Epstein matter and a potential trafficking case. Discussions involve the “SOL” issue in Cosby, the Florida NPA’s legal impact, and coordinating a call to determine the next steps in the Epstein investigation. An article regarding Epstein’s financial fraud case is shared, soliciting insights.  Multiple individuals, including an Assistant United States Attorney and an FBI agent, are involved in the communications.

This document is a correspondence regarding the Epstein case, specifically a motion filed by plaintiffs in the case (8 Civ 80736) involving the Southern District of New York. Attachments include a motion, memorandum, government reply, and a NPA (likely a related document). The sender is an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York contacted another party regarding a paralegal interested in working sex trafficking cases, specifically referencing a potential need for a paralegal related to the Epstein case.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York forwarded an email to another party regarding a paralegal interested in working on sex trafficking cases, specifically related to Jeffrey Epstein. The email was sent by an individual at the USANYS office.

This document pertains to a case, 15 Civ. 7433 and 19 Misc. 149, involving John E. (JE) and General Motors, Ltd. (GM). It includes materials related to Judge McMahon's consideration of unsealing requests, specifically a February 5, 2019 application and order, a January 28, 2019 application regarding the JEJetter, transcripts of unsealing conferences from March 27, 2019 and April 9, 2019, a sealed memorandum and order from April 9, 2019, an unsealing order shared with BSF from April 9, 2019, and an August 4, 2020 unsealing request for discovery. The sender is an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York.

The FBI possesses substantial data related to the Epstein case and is offering it to the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Coordination is requested regarding the logistics of uploading this data to a shared location.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested the search warrant affidavit and order for Jeffrey Epstein’s residence from an unknown sender on March 20, 2019. The sender stated they had a copy in their files and were unable to locate it through their own review. The request was sent in connection with the Epstein investigation.

On March 20, 2019, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested the email containing the search warrant affidavit and order for the Epstein residence from an individual with the alias “Ma, (MM) (FBI).” This request stemmed from an inability to locate the documents within previously reviewed materials related to the Epstein investigation. A follow-up email from “EMM, (MM) (FBI)” on March 21, 2019, indicated they were unavailable and would send the documents the following morning. A subsequent reply from “j II [REDACTED]” confirmed they would email the documents.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested an update to the “Epstein Universe” with information regarding victim attorneys. The request was made on April 8, 2019, due to concerns about accuracy and the high volume of witnesses involved. The document referenced is EFTA00019554.

A forfeiture document (TVPA and Forfeiture(2).docx) was sent from Abby, an Assistant United States Attorney, to MINI1 from [REDACTED] on April 24, 2019. The document pertains to EFTA00020701 and includes information related to Money Laundering & Transnational Criminal Enterprise Unit of New York.

An Assistant United States Attorney in New York is requesting a redaction analysis of file EFTA00019864. Specifically, they are asking for checks on several phone numbers and associated records, including: *   A number referenced in 302s containing messages and New York-based numbers. *   A number matching a phone message discussed yesterday, with subpoenaed tolls and subscriber records requested. *   A last name “esterday” requiring a workup. *   Six different phone messages from a number originating from West Palm Beach. *   Multiple phone messages from an unidentified number.

An email discusses travel arrangements for Jeffrey Epstein, referencing the following airport codes: KTEB, TEB, CYYR, LFPB, and TIST. The email originates from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, and relates to case file EFTA00020689.

A status memo was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to [REDACTED] regarding a document (2019-04-26 JE status memo _forl y2.docx). The sender believes the memo is close to the final version, noting edits made while they were in the recipient’s office.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is requesting a searchable version of FOIA scans related to “tolls.” The request includes the location of phone records within PDFs labeled “31E-MM-108062-1A SEC.003 pages 715-925.”

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is requesting a searchable version of FOIA scans related to “tolls.” The scans, specifically pages 715-925 of PDFs labeled “31E-MM-108062-1A SEC.003,” are located in a folder containing phone records.

A request is made to identify a phone number from a handwritten message. The Assistant United States Attorney intends to obtain the phone number through a subpoena, potentially utilizing a service provider lookup. The message originates from an unidentified sender and includes contact information for the Assistant United States Attorney's office.

On June 11, 2019, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested a review of phone and flight records. The records detail four calls made on September 16, 2004, and information regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s arrival at PBI Airport (Palm Beach International Airport) on a Boeing 727 at 10:16 PM.

An indictment was prepared by the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York regarding Jeffrey Epstein. All edits were accepted and redlined for accuracy, with some comments regarding the level of detail added. The document is attached as 2019-06-14_Epstein_Indictment.agm.docx.

An Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York requested the retrieval of Epstein’s most recent SORNA (Safer Online Recording Network Act) registration documents, as the existing filing was from April 2018 and potentially outdated.

An email was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, to an unidentified recipient. The email subject is blank, and the date is June 16, 2019. The email references a file named “PBPD Search Photos\scene 1 \DCIM \100NCD70” and is associated with an investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein and the New York Attorney General's office. The file name contains references to "NYAStAndrews" and “Shared WSyEpstein-2018R01618.”

This document is an email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and another party regarding a Curbed.com article published in 2015 about Jeffrey Epstein’s property holdings. The email is dated June 17, 2019.

This document pertains to a case file, EFTA00014384, involving transcripts dated 2019-06-19 and 2019-07-19. The transcripts were sent by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York to MEIMEM.
A transcript is attached to an email from the Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, dated June 19, 2019. The transcript pertains to case EFTA00030275.

An email thread discusses a meeting regarding a forfeiture question related to a property involved in the Jeffrey Epstein case. Ted and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York are available to meet with others at times between 1:00 PM and 2:00 PM, or 2:30 PM and 4:00 PM. One Saint Andrew’s Plaza (EFTA00014287) is also referenced.

A draft search warrant for a New York residence (identified as “NY residence”) was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to multiple recipients. The warrant, titled “New_York_Residence_SW_v3.docx,” was attached and intended for use in connection with an arrest planned for the same day. The sender requested input on the affiant and offered to discuss revisions.

The United States of America filed a nolle prosequi, seeking to drop the charges against Jeffrey Epstein in case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), due to Epstein’s death on July 2, 2019. The original indictment charged Epstein with conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking of minors. The Assistant United States Attorneys and United States Attorney recommended and the Judge ordered the nolle prosequi to be filed with respect to Jeffrey Epstein.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent a search warrant application to Judge Nathan Moses of the New York State Court System on July 5, 2019. The application was attached to an email with the subject "Search Warrant Application" and included the document "2019.07.05 New York_Residence_SW.pdf." The sender’s phone number is redacted.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York submitted a search warrant application (2019.07.05_New_York_Residence_SW.pdf) to Judge Moses Nysdchambers on July 5, 2019, via email. The application was sent from One Saint Andrew’s Plaza, New York, NY 10007.

A correspondence regarding "SW" originating from the Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, dated July 5, 2019, is attached. The document, titled "2019.07.05_New_York_Residence_SW.pdf," appears to relate to a case involving EFTA00030175.

On July 6, 2019, Judge Moses signed a search warrant related to Epstein. The FBI received a flight manifest from CBP listing Epstein and two pilots. Agents were preparing to execute search warrants and were available to assist with supplemental warrants if needed. Geoffrey Berman, an Assistant United States Attorney, reported that Epstein was confirmed on board a flight.

Geoffrey Berman, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, forwarded updates regarding the Epstein case. Judge Moses signed a search warrant, and the FBI received a flight manifest from CBP listing Jeffrey Epstein and two pilots. The information is subject to change, and the FBI intends to confirm passenger details after the flight departs.

A correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an unnamed recipient regarding a subpoena and a request for email correspondence. The subpoena seeks recordings of Jeffrey Epstein’s phone calls (excluding attorney calls) and requests all email correspondence of Jeffrey Epstein from July 6, 2019, through July 11, 2019, excluding emails between Estin and Marc Fernich, Weinberg, and Reid Weingarten. The sender emphasizes the need for expedited receipt of the requested materials and provides contact information.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent an email regarding a search warrant to [REDACTED] on July 7, 2019. The email included an attachment named “Second_New_York_Residence_SW.y3.docx.”

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York submitted an application and proposed warrant (attached as 2019.07.07_Media_SW.pdf) to Judge Moses for her consideration. The application was prepared by a Special Agent, who was available for consultation at the Court. A response from U.S. Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses requested the application by 11:00 PM on July 7, 2019, suggesting presentation to Judge Pitman if not received by that time.

An email was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to multiple recipients regarding document EFTA00030818. The email includes a rough draft attached, with minor edits to a rider and bullet points added as reminders. The sender requests a review and input due to a quick turnaround requested by the FBI, noting uncertainty about the scope of the search.

Assistant United States Attorney and a lawyer from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., are coordinating regarding a subpoena for Ms. Maxwell related to a case involving Mr. Epstein. *   The indictment is currently under seal but expected to be unsealed the following morning. *   A call is scheduled for 4:00 PM (Eastern Time) to discuss scheduling a meeting for Ms. Maxwell to appear or provide testimony. *   The lawyer anticipates difficulty obtaining a copy of the indictment and requests the Assistant U.S. Attorney to email it along with the subpoena and waiver. *   The Assistant U.S. Attorney will be available between 11:00 AM and 12:00 PM and again at 4:00 PM (local time) to discuss the matter.

This email chain discusses the legal representation of Jeffrey Epstein, specifically referencing Martin Weinberg Law and Steptoe & Johnson LLP. An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York provided links to the websites of these law firms. The email is dated July 8, 2019.

An email exchange occurred between two individuals, one a Special Assistant United States Attorney from the Eastern District of Virginia and another individual, regarding the Epstein case. The first email expresses excitement about the recipient's work on the case and general well-being. The second email confirms the recipient’s work on the case and expresses positive sentiment.

An email exchange discusses a prisoner production request for court. The request is for Jeffrey Epstein (USMS # 76318-054) related to case # 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), specifically a detention hearing. The requested time is 10:00 AM on 7/15/19, with Judge Berman in room 17B. The production type is marked as “X” for detention hearings, and the remarks include security precautions and a violent crime charge. Contact information for the Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, is provided.

A communication occurred between the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Assistant United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York (EDNY) regarding a potential witness in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The witness contacted the EDNY, requesting to speak with someone from the USAO, and after failing to connect, contacted the SDNY. The SDNY forwarded the matter to the EDNY, with an attached memorandum documenting the call.

On July 9, 2019, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent a Word document (“2019-07-08, JE, detention memo, final.docx”) regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s bail letter to an unidentified recipient. The document was requested to be used in preparing a detention application based on risk of flight and included case law/rhetoric.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York forwarded an internal instruction to the Chief Security Officers (CSOs) regarding incoming calls related to Jeffrey Epstein. The instruction directed CSOs to transfer any incoming calls to extension 212-637-1030, where messages would automatically forward to the team. The email chain discusses the volume of calls and the establishment of a dedicated internal line for Epstein-related inquiries.

A correspondence occurred between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an individual identified as (USANYS) regarding a bail letter related to Jeffrey Epstein. The Assistant U.S. Attorney requested a word document of the bail letter to use in preparing a detention application focusing on risk of flight, citing case law and rhetoric. Attached documents included a memo and a final document labeled “finaLdocx”.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent an email requesting review of a draft affidavit supporting an amended warrant for three drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein’s New York residence. The email included attachments of the draft affidavit, four exhibits related to previous warrants (July 11, 2019, June 2020, and a superseding indictment), and was sent to NYPD and USANYS personnel. The attorney intends to schedule a time to administer an oath for the warrant.

An email chain discusses filing a bail reply letter. The email thread originates from an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, referencing attachments including government opposition to a bail motion with and without exhibits. The sender is logging on remotely while awaiting a flight to complete the filing.

An email exchange regarding the filing of a bail reply letter. The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, logged in remotely while awaiting a flight, confirmed the filing and attached the document “2019-07-12, JE_government_opposition_to_bail_motioniwith_exhibits).pdf.”

An email was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to request a review of an affidavit seeking a search warrant. The affidavit pertains to electronic media seized from Jeffrey Epstein’s phone, iPad, and suitcases. The goal is to have the affidavit sworn out following the bail hearing.

A U.S. Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent an email to Judge Berman regarding the case *U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein* (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The email included attachments of the Government’s supplemental submission, including a redacted and an unredacted version. Exhibits A, B, and C were attached; Exhibits A and C were publicly filed, while Exhibits B and C were requested to be filed under seal.

An email chain discusses the review of a document ("photos") involving individuals identified as "[REDACTED]," "[REDACTED]," and "[REDACTED]," and “[REDACTED]” (USANYS). A team has reviewed the document and discussed it. One member, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, informed the group that Judge Berman does not want to see the photographs and that the document would be circulated for comments.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent photographs to Mike regarding the case *U.S. v. Epstein* (19 Cr. 490 [RMB]). The Attorney confirmed that pages 6 and 7 of the relevant document were blank and were not photographed.

On July 17, 2019, Mike Monico and Barry Spevack, representing Cohen, contacted the Assistant United States Attorney regarding a potential Rule 35 motion. They inquired about a previous statement made on April 17 regarding not filing such a motion, citing Cohen’s reported hearing of Trump’s statements about Epstein. The attorney indicated a willingness to consider providing more specifics, but Cohen representatives attempted to revisit the prior conversation and challenge Cohen’s credibility.

Martin Weinberg inquired about the availability of the original documents related to the U.S. v. Epstein case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). Mike, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, attached photographs and stated that pages 6 and 7 were blank and unphotographed.

An email chain discusses a court production request for Jeffrey Epstein (USMS inmate number 76318-054) related to case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), specifically an arraignment. The request is for a production at 9:30 AM on July 18, 2019, in Room 17B, presided over by Judge Berman. The production type is designated as "Detention Hearing," and security precautions are noted due to a violent crime charge. Contact information for the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York is provided.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested post-arrest statements and a report regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s statements from [REDACTED]. The request originated from an NYPD Detective with the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force and the N.Y. FBI Squad C20.  Attached files included images and a photocopy of an “Epstein Arrest Folder.”

Tartaglione. *   A request was made for statements from Mr. Tartaglione given interviews conducted by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding Epstein’s attempted suicide on July 23, 2019. *   A zip folder containing statements attributed to Mr. Tartaglione (including those conveyed by Epstein to MCC staff) was provided. *   A request was made for all reports and video related to Epstein’s attempted suicide on July 22-23, 2019, but this request was denied, citing irrelevance and Rule 16. *   The Assistant United States Attorney stipulated that the request required a release from Touhy, a Touhy letter, and a subpoena. *   Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP is involved in the legal proceedings.

A protective order, drafted by an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, is being sent to Martin G. Weinberg regarding the case EFTA00021650. The order was discussed with Michael Miller, Reid Marty, and others, and the sender requests feedback or a call to discuss it.

A protective order was drafted and circulated between Martin G. Weinberg and the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York regarding a case (EFTA00028423). Weinberg requested revisions to the order, specifically addressing points on pages 2 and 3, including consent to the order’s entry, distinctions between electronic and hard copy discovery, obligations extending to the government, considerations for witness identification, and the potential for redaction of allegations related to witness obstruction. Weinberg requested clarification on the marking of 302s and the status of public filings. The Assistant U.S. Attorney attached the proposed order for review.

An email chain between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and recipients regarding a protective order related to discovery in the case EFTA00021648. The email discusses a revised version of the protective order with highlighted changes and requests confirmation for its release. An attachment, “2019-07-24,_JE,_protective_order_for_discoveryiRMB).docx,” is included.

Daniel Rose reported escalating harassment directed at a woman ("Ms. M") including text messages from reporters and the unauthorized uploading of a Jeffrey Epstein video to her YouTube account. He was seeking assistance in stopping the media attention. An Assistant United States Attorney contacted Daniel Rose to offer support and connect him with the FBI’s victim coordinator, , to discuss resources for Ms. M’s safety and wellness. Two redactions are present in the document.

Martin G. Weinberg, Esq., is coordinating a call with multiple parties, including an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and assistants from Steptoe and potentially Marc Fernich and Weingarten, Reid. The call is regarding an incident involving Mr. Epstein at the MCC.  Requests are made for Mike Miller to join the call via conference and for contact information (specifically Mike Miller’s number) to be provided.  A proposed time of 3:00 PM is discussed, with an alternative suggestion of 2:00 PM. Redactions are present throughout the document.

An email was sent from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unidentified recipient regarding a protective order for discovery. The email attached a document titled “protective_order_for_discovery_(RMB).docx” and requests confirmation to proceed with the new language.

On July 25, 2019, a Supervisory Staff Attorney from CLC New York Metropolitan Correctional Center requested documents and materials related to the investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein from an Assistant United States Attorney. The request included staff memos and photographs. The sender noted a requirement for a written request for the documents, specifying an email would suffice instead of a subpoena. EFTA00028434 and EFTA00028435 are associated file identifiers.

The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York is requesting drives from recipients (including Michael Miller, Martin Weinberg, Reid, and Marc Fernich) to load approximately 12 GB of discovery data. Drives should be delivered to the office address or brought to a conference. A separate hard drive is requested for Mr. Epstein to review the discovery at the MCC.

Martin Weinberg, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent an email to counsel regarding the production of discovery in the case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB). The discovery, including a letter from Michael Miller, was loaded onto a drive and available for pickup at the U.S. Attorney's office. Weinberg offered assistance if there were any difficulties accessing the discovery.

An attorney at CLC New York Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York is responding to an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s injuries. The investigation is described as nearing completion, with Epstein receiving an incident report for self-mutilation and a pending DHO hearing. It details the trial logistics, including courtroom locations (40 Foley, 110, 506, 905, 906, and 130), timing (starting at 8:30 a.m. with preliminary instructions and opening statements), and advises early arrival for seating. The United States of America, through the Assistant United States Attorney, filed a Nolle Prosequi (a dismissal of charges) for defendants Tova Noel and Michael Thomas in Case 1:19-cr-00830-AT. The defendants were initially indicted on charges of conspiracy to defraud the United States and making false writings, stemming from Indictment 19 Cr. 830 (AT). Subsequently, they entered into a deferred prosecution agreement which was successfully completed with compliance monitored by the United States Pretrial Services Office.  Based on this compliance, the United States District Judge ordered the Nolle Prosequi to be filed.

The New Mexico Office of the Attorney General, led by Clara Moran, is continuing a criminal investigation into potential collaborators of Jeffrey Epstein.
